metadata.synopsis:
Avatar attempts to rest on the first night, and reflects on what has happened on the nautiloid.

JLatino: Look at cinematic context for mocap direction

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Falling into your trance should have been as easy as breathing, yet peace eludes you.*
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

143.speaker: Narrator
143.text: *You picture the Feywild in its colourful glory, the joy of all seasons flourishing at once.*
143.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

18.speaker: Narrator
18.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*
18.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

168.speaker: Narrator
168.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*
168.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

188.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: nature's sublime majesty.*

71.speaker: Narrator
71.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: wild, glorious magic.*

217.speaker: Narrator
217.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

127.speaker: Narrator
127.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.
93.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

11.speaker: Narrator
11.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You are one with the forest again, sitting at peace.*
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You are one with the Feywild again, agleam in revelry.*

3.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

195.speaker: Narrator
195.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*
195.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

158.speaker: Narrator
158.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*
158.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elf player collapses from their trance, passing out. Fade to black.

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *You seek rest, but an active mind refuses you.*

0.speaker: Narrator
0.text: *Images overwhelm you: the kith'raki attacking the nautiloid; warring demons and devils; the twitching ghaik tadpole.*

181.speaker: Narrator
181.text: *Your head twinges. Is it the tadpole, you wonder? Had you imagined it - or were you soon to turn?*

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *'Suffering is not a curse, but a gift'. So the varsh had taught you.*

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *'Suffering is not a curse, but a gift'. So the varsh had taught you.*

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *You will take this chance to overcome and ascend. Even the kith'raki will bow to you.*

122.speaker: Narrator
122.text: *Your thoughts turn to courage; a deep sleep soon follows.*

183.text: *No exercise had prepared you for such extraordinary circumstances.*

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: *No exercise had prepared you for such extraordinary circumstances.*

28.speaker: Player
28.text: Imagine yourself beheading the very ghaik that had infected you.

185.speaker: Narrator
185.text: *You can almost feel its thick skull in your grasp, almost smell its silver blood clogging the air.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *You can almost feel its thick skull in your grasp, almost smell its silver blood clogging the air.*

147.speaker: Narrator
147.text: *You offer the head to Vlaakith, your queen. She hands you a sword of silver in return.*

225.text: *Agitation overcomes imagination. Like it or not, the ghaik has bested you this day.*

4.speaker: Narrator
4.text: *Agitation overcomes imagination. Like it or not, the ghaik has bested you this day.*

215.speaker: Narrator
215.text: *You fall into fitful sleep, your dreams dominated by the blood-lakes of Hell and snarling ghaik.*

202.speaker: Player
202.text: Shut your mind to all thought.

79.speaker: Narrator
79.text: *You drive away all fears, and give yourself to the darkness. A deep sleep soon follows.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *You drive away all fears, and give yourself to the darkness. A deep sleep soon follows.*

111.text: *There is no conquering the agitation. Like it or not, mind flayers have bested you this day.*

186.speaker: Narrator
186.text: *There is no conquering the agitation. Like it or not, mind flayers have bested you this day.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Warm air; rustling leaves. A perfect night to sleep under the stars.*

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *A shame your mind has other ideas.*

52.speaker: Narrator
52.text: *One moment, you'd been bartering with Mizora for freedom. The next, whisked away by tentacle monsters.*

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Put Mizora out of your mind. A cure for this tadpole is your top priority.

119.speaker: Narrator
119.text: *You imagine your fingers contorting into claws, and your skin rippling and bulging.*

9.speaker: Narrator
9.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers. You'd conquered bugbears and banshees! You'd conquer this challenge, too.*

26.speaker: Narrator
26.text: *You clench your eyes tighter and search for sleep in the darkness.*

206.speaker: Player
206.text: Think back to the abduction. What do these creatures want with you?

51.speaker: Narrator
51.text: *To make you one of them, of course. Isn't that what mind flayers always want?*

227.speaker: Narrator
227.text: *A simple explanation. And wrong, you wager.*

178.speaker: Narrator
178.text: *Are you such precious cargo that they'd race through the Hells' bowels to protect you?*

171.speaker: Narrator
171.text: *Devils and demons swarm your thoughts. Soon, they will be swarming your dreams.*

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Let your mind drift to Mizora. What would it take for her to break your pact?

131.speaker: Narrator
131.text: *What was it Mizora had said? Oh yes - 'Over your rotting corpse'.*

182.speaker: Narrator
182.text: *You'd do anything to be a great hero - or so you once thought.*

85.speaker: Narrator
85.text: *But some promises, even the Blade of Frontiers can't keep.*

55.speaker: Narrator
55.text: *You clench your eyes tight and leap into darkness. And like always, Mizora follows closely behind.*

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text:
|Damn, hard to sleep. Can't stop thinking about everything...
Come dawn, I need to focus on [main goal] - that's the best I can do right now...
...and there's my [Origin concerns] to deal with as well... I need to take my mind off all of this, rest...
...better start counting those stars... zzz|

72.speaker: Narrator
72.text: *Rest eludes you as you stare at the wrong side of the stars.*

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *The ghaik larva is curled up in your skull, no doubt pleased with itself.*

107.speaker: Narrator
107.text: *Without a cure, you cannot restore your honour before Vlaakith.*

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Contemplate peace. Death can be sought in battle if purification is too far.

105.speaker: Narrator
105.text: *You picture a silver blade cleaving through ghaik and their thralls, one after another.*

146.speaker: Narrator
146.text: *You picture a silver blade cleaving through ghaik and their thralls, one after another.*

74.speaker: Narrator
74.text: *Every cut is meditation. It reshapes the world to Vlaakith's will.*

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *Sleep comes as you count the fields of the dead, soon to grow.*

140.text: *Every day this abomination is in your head, you put others at risk.*

57.speaker: Narrator
57.text: *Every day this abomination is in your head, you put others at risk.*

144.speaker: Narrator
144.text: *There is no peace in that truth, only an unease that steals away any chance of sleep.*

224.speaker: Player
224.text: Rage fills you. Turn the feeling to higher purpose.

45.speaker: Narrator
45.text: *Every abomination would be gutted and burned to ash.*

65.speaker: Narrator
65.text: *Every abomination would be gutted and burned to ash.*

159.speaker: Narrator
159.text: *Your anger is clarifying, pure and bright. It burns away all doubt.*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *As the fire settles, tension bleeds from your body.*

133.speaker: Narrator
133.text: *Tomorrow, you will fight harder than ever before.*

126.text: *You have been enslaved like your ancestors! Rage sparks to hatred.*

151.speaker: Narrator
151.text: *You have been enslaved like your ancestors! Rage sparks to hatred.*

67.speaker: Narrator
67.text: *It burns relentlessly, like a red dragon's breath scorching you from the inside out.*

30.speaker: Narrator
30.text: *Stripped raw and restless, you find no peace that night.*

166.speaker: Player
166.text: Shame claws at you like rot. Are you a failure?

68.speaker: Narrator
68.text: *No. You would only be a failure if you stop fighting.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *No. You would only be a failure if you stop fighting.*

197.speaker: Narrator
197.text: *Your honour can be restored before Vlaakith. It would be restored.*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text: *Resolve strengthened, you fall into a deep slumber.*

61.text: *You have prepared all your life to fight the ghaik. You dream of presenting one of their vile heads to Vlaakith in Tu'narath!*

160.speaker: Narrator
160.text: *You have prepared all your life to fight the ghaik. You dream of presenting one of their vile heads to Vlaakith in Tu'narath!*

135.speaker: Narrator
135.text: *How were you caught off-guard on the nautiloid? What was the crucial mistake?*

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *Without answers, you lay haunted for the rest of the night.*

170.speaker: Narrator
170.text: *Gazing up at the night sky, you try to will yourself to sleep.*

210.speaker: Narrator
210.text: *Useless - you can't stop thinking of Shar's sacred mission.*

190.speaker: Narrator
190.text: *Protect the box. Find your contact in Baldur's Gate. Fulfil Shar's command.*

84.speaker: Player
84.text: Reach for the box, hidden among your belongings.

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *Its weight reassures you. Shar's will and your destiny, right in your grasp.*

125.speaker: Narrator
125.text: *So many brothers and sisters sacrificed for it. Only you remain.*

132.speaker: Narrator
132.text: *... you and the vile creature inside you. The mere thought of it makes you shiver.*

42.speaker: Narrator
42.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Shar herself is counting on you.*

153.speaker: Narrator
153.text: *If sleep won't come to you, at least darkness will.*

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Shut your eyes and silently thank Shar for the night's beauty.

141.speaker: Narrator
141.text: *You hear only your own thoughts. Shar's presence won't come to you - why?*

24.speaker: Narrator
24.text: *You have fulfilled her will - retrieved the relic for her. Everyone has perished but you.*

75.speaker: Narrator
75.text: *... you, and your parasite. You are tainted now. Imperfect.*

89.speaker: Narrator
89.text: *You have to rid yourself of the tadpole. Then Shar will come to you - honour you as you honour her.*

208.speaker: Player
208.text: Pray to Shar. Her blessing will help you weather the trials ahead.

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Only the sounds of the wilderness answer.*

173.speaker: Player
173.text: Try to remember what came before the mission.

180.speaker: Narrator
180.text: *Your memories are foggy - as your mission requires them to be: Shar's secrets are precious.*

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *As precious as sleep, and the night's oblivion.*

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Let your thoughts turn to the crash.

124.speaker: Narrator
124.text: *... all nothing compared to what came before. Compared to the tadpole.*

163.speaker: Narrator
163.text: *It's still inside you. Does it watch the night sky even now, through your eyes?*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *You have to get rid of it. You have to survive. You are the only one left to ensure Shar's glory.*

187.speaker: Narrator
187.text: *The dark is familiar, but not comforting. It is a struggle to sink into your trance, weaving together memory, ambition, and purpose.*

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *You picture a cup, ancient and elven: priceless. Drinking from it honours the dead - those lost to Lolth's predation.*

109.speaker: Narrator
109.text: *Fire spills across your thoughts: dragon's breath. The tadpole slithers, twisting deeper into your skull.*

134.speaker: Narrator
134.text: *Your head is about to burst. The memory consumes your mind, corrupting the trance.*

191.speaker: Player
191.text: You have walked your dreams countless times before. Will this memory to pass.

91.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: blood and darkness.*

120.speaker: Narrator
120.text: *The flames cool, dispelled as the image you know emerges again: blood and darkness.*

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Refuse to break. Anything can be endured in the trance.

32.speaker: Narrator
32.text: *The fire fades, a meaningless distraction. You hold the cup again, ignoring the crack along its belly, and drink.*

56.speaker: Narrator
56.text: *The fire fades, a meaningless distraction. You hold the cup again, ignoring the crack along its belly, and drink.*

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *As the trance stabilises, your breath deepens. Be it cure or cage, something must be done about the tadpole.*

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *Every night that passes is another night the monster inside you grows.*

200.speaker: Narrator
200.text: *The flames fall away, a mere illusion. You sit the dark again, beside Lolth's majesty.*

220.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

100.speaker: Narrator
100.text: *Hell surrounds you, flames licking at your body. The tadpole in your head convulses.*

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *Agony bursts behind your eyes, and the whole world goes dark.*

15.speaker: Narrator
15.text: *The vision in your mind is simple: a stone altar to Lolth, the knife upon it bloody with sacrifice.*

218.speaker: Narrator
218.text: *The day had been a surreal spectacle - scarcely to be comprehended by the sane mind.*

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Place a hand over the back of your head, trying to feel the tadpole.

31.speaker: Narrator
31.text: *Nothing. Does a tadpole sleep? You tell yourself that's a silly thing to wonder.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *Next you feel a sudden wave of nauseating terror: in seven days you'll be a mind flayer.*

165.speaker: Narrator
165.text: *As if you don't have enough problems already...*

110.speaker: Narrator
110.text: *No! You refuse to accept it. If there's magic that can hold cities afloat, there has to be magic that can wither a damned tadpole.*

16.speaker: Narrator
16.text: *With or without Mystra's help, tomorrow you will find it.*

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Foremost in your thoughts is the mind flayer - its unexpected voice.

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *It had been melodious - soothing even. Not in the most detailed of tomes have you encountered mention of such a thing.*

198.speaker: Narrator
198.text: *But you'll know all about it soon enough. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer yourself.*

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You recall the dragons. Not even Hell had stopped them.

129.speaker: Narrator
129.text: *They were majestic in their fury. Could they too be vanquished by something as small as a tadpole?*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *It's a question destined to remain unanswered. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer yourself.*

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Shove the images away. You need sleep.

223.speaker: Narrator
223.text: *The memories blacken into oblivion, only to be replaced by a number.*

179.speaker: Narrator
179.text: *Seven. In seven days you'll be a mind flayer.*

203.speaker: Narrator
203.text: *A calm night is a mercy, yet your eyes refuse to stay closed.*
203.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying on his side, turns to lie on back

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *Every time they flicker shut, the tadpole seems to twitch behind them.*

35.speaker: Narrator
35.text: *Dragons, gith, and the Hells themselves have come after you. Yet it is this creature that lingers in your skull.*

130.speaker: Player
130.text: Focus. Finding a cure is all that matters.

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *And you will find it, no matter the cost.*

207.speaker: Narrator
207.text: *Your life is your own. No wriggling tadpole is going to change that.*

212.speaker: Narrator
212.text: *Sleep claims you, determination buoyed by gentle dreams.*

137.speaker: Player
137.text: You have to learn to control the tadpole. It's dangerous, but powerful.

213.speaker: Narrator
213.text: *All you have to do is turn the tables - cage the creature before it cages you.*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text: *You wonder if it could hear these thoughts - if it knows you're planning a rebellion.*

49.speaker: Narrator
49.text: *Let it listen. You will dream of all the ways to make this power your own.*

142.speaker: Player
142.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

204.speaker: Narrator
204.text: *You belong with dark stone and black iron. There is work to be done.*

194.speaker: Narrator
194.text: *You belong with your people, down in the dark that never fades.*

97.speaker: Narrator
97.text: *Your people have survived the drow, the duergar, and every monster the Underdark has to offer. A mind flayer is nothing.*

22.speaker: Narrator
22.text: *Under the strange and open sky, sleep claims you.*

201.text: *Yet the tadpole is in the dark too. Dozens of them, crawling towards you as a mind flayer held your skull in its psionic grip.*

138.speaker: Narrator
138.text: *Yet the tadpole is in the dark too. Dozens of them, crawling towards you as a mind flayer held your skull in its psionic grip.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Disgust churns deep in your stomach, leaving you resigned to a night without sleep.*

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Force the tadpole out of your mind. Think of home instead.

99.speaker: Narrator
99.text: *Baldur's Gate feels almost like a dream, after everything that has happened to you.*

25.speaker: Narrator
25.text: *Baldur's Gate feels almost like a dream, after everything that has happened to you.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: *Yet it is a dream of hope. You may be countless miles away, but it isn't an impossible journey.*

44.speaker: Narrator
44.text: *You will see those gates again. That promise sinks deep into your heart as your eyes drift shut.*

149.text: *Except all you can picture is citizens with their skulls splintering open, tentacles sprouting from broken mouths.*

76.speaker: Narrator
76.text: *Except all you can picture is citizens with their skulls splintering open, tentacles sprouting from broken mouths.*

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *Their empty, alien eyes haunt you through a night of fitful sleep.*

103.speaker: Player
103.text: The tadpole influences you. Perhaps you might influence it in return...

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *You focus on that spot of pain from when it slipped behind your eye, to where it now lurks.*

219.speaker: Narrator
219.text: *You focus on that spot of pain from when it slipped behind your eye, to where it now lurks.*

214.speaker: Narrator
214.text: *You cannot prod it, but you can make it clear that you are watching. What is there to fear when it is the one stuck inside you?*

139.speaker: Narrator
139.text: *It is a minor victory, but enough to soothe you to sleep.*

17.text: *The thought is punished by a spike of pain driven right between your eyes.*

136.speaker: Narrator
136.text: *The thought is punished by a spike of pain driven right between your eyes.*

209.speaker: Narrator
209.text: *The agony refuses to fade until you collapse against your bedroll in a cold sweat.*

216.speaker: Narrator
216.text: *You try to rest, but your mind won't settle.*
216.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lying on his side, turns to lie on back

222.speaker: Narrator
222.text: *Just yesterday you were seducing a young noble, luring him to your master's lair.*

78.speaker: Narrator
78.text: *Today? You'd been kidnapped by mind flayers, chased through Hell by dragons, and thrown out of a burning ship.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *And you felt the sun on your skin...*

211.speaker: Player
211.text: Recall the light's comforting warmth. It's been an eternity.

90.speaker: Narrator
90.text: *You wonder if your ability to walk in the sun is a side effect of the tadpole the mind flayer put in your eye. It must be?*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *All you know for sure is, given time, it will turn you into one of them.*

58.speaker: Narrator
58.text: *Getting rid of the tadpole will mean returning to the darkness. Unless...*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *... unless you understand it. Master it. Which means finding an expert.*

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Focus on the problem - who would know the most about this?

33.speaker: Narrator
33.text: *You mentally shuffle through places likely to have an expert in mind flayers. Candlekeep? Neverwinter? Menzoberranzan? Baldur's Gate...*

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *You mentally shuffle through places likely to have an expert in mind flayers. Candlekeep? Neverwinter? Menzoberranzan? Baldur's Gate...*

113.speaker: Narrator
113.text: *Baldur's Gate is close to your master's coven, but also home to amazing scholars. Still, that's a problem for the morning.*
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

167.text: *You try to focus, but all you can see are the menacing eyes of a mind flayer.*

108.speaker: Narrator
108.text: *You try to focus, but all you can see are the menacing eyes of a mind flayer.*

177.speaker: Player
177.text: Roll over, push it all from your mind.

69.text: *You think on the day. The sunshine. Being alive - more or less.*

66.speaker: Narrator
66.text: *You think on the day. The sunshine. Being alive - more or less.*

62.speaker: Narrator
62.text: *Despite everything, you relax into peaceful meditation, satisfied with all that's happened. Perhaps you wouldn't sleep so well if you knew what was coming.*

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Close your eyes. Relax. Imagine dragging your old master into the sunlight.
80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

102.speaker: Narrator
102.text: *You smile, meditating on the flames that engulf his cruel face.*
102.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *You smile, meditating on the flames that engulf his cruel face.*
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brings arms down to side to sleep

114.text: *You close your eyes and try to focus on his delightful screams, but they quickly turn into your own. They only stop when tentacles burst from your mouth.*

174.speaker: Narrator
174.text: *You close your eyes and try to focus on his delightful screams, but they quickly turn into your own. They only stop when tentacles burst from your mouth.*

175.speaker: Narrator
175.text: *You shudder, resigning yourself to whatever dark rest awaits you.*

50.speaker: Player
50.text: Think about your master. He'll be furious you didn't bring him dinner.

189.speaker: Narrator
189.text: *He'll believe you if you tell him what happened. But he won't forgive.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Of course - you might already be a mind flayer by the time you return to Cazador.*

116.speaker: Narrator
116.text: *You could try getting rid of the tadpole, but that probably means returning to the darkness. Unless...*

205.speaker: Player
205.text: Consider the tadpole. Can a vampire spawn even become a mind flayer?

73.speaker: Narrator
73.text: *The worm in your head might not even have an appetite for undead meat.*

193.speaker: Narrator
193.text: *Until you know more about the tadpole, you can't be sure how much danger you're in.*

7.speaker: Narrator
7.text: *You have to understand it. Master it. Which means you need to find an expert.*
